text:
I have Apache 2.0.53 installed on freebsd 5.4-RELEASE i386.

I am using mod_proxy for tomcat 5.5.25.

ProxyTimeOut directive does not work on 32bit machine. Looks like apache 2.0.53 ignores ProxyTimeOut directive. 

I can't upgrade my apache to latest one.
creator: arpan_khandelwal@persistent.co.in
rpluem@apache.org
text: This is fixed in the latest version. So you either have to upgrade or live with it.

I am digging into the code, since I need to fix this bug in 2.0.53 itself

I did-
------------------------
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/httpd/httpd/branches/2.0.x/modules/proxy/mod_proxy.c?view=log
<Snip>
Revision 535853 - Backport to close PR 11540
Diff to previous 421178
</Snip>

++++
and 
++++

this http://marc.info/?l=apache-httpd-dev&m=120646925405278&q=p3
description http://marc.info/?l=apache-httpd-dev&m=120646925405278&w=2
------------------------
but still both of the fixes are not working.

Could you guys please let me know what exactly I am missing ?
creator: arpan_khandelwal@persistent.co.in

text: Have a look at the 2.2.x code and find out the difference between the 2.0.x and the 2.2.x code regarding timeout handling.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
